channel.title: Comments on: Microsoft SQL Server, codename “Denali”, will be the last release to support OLE DB, ODBC is the new new thing
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Andrew Barker
item.dc:creator: Andrew Barker
item.description: I support a couple of in house adp projects, which use ADO and OLEDB to connect to SQL server. Has anyone got advice on the best alternatives to this setup, losing the minimal of coding investment, and what are the gotchas?
item.content:encoded: I support a couple of in house adp projects, which use ADO and OLEDB to connect to SQL server. Has anyone got advice on the best alternatives to this setup, losing the minimal of coding investment, and what are the gotchas?

item.title: By: genomon
item.dc:creator: genomon
item.description: Is this the same Microsoft that reccomended using the OLEDB provider when connecting to SQL Server from Office apps such as Access? The (Evil) Empire Strikes Back...
item.content:encoded: Is this the same Microsoft that reccomended using the OLEDB provider when connecting to SQL Server from Office apps such as Access? The (Evil) Empire Strikes Back…

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.description: We typically use ODBC where we can't use SqlClient / OracleClient. It will be nice to have a real standard in the future I suppose.
item.content:encoded: We typically use ODBC where we can’t use SqlClient / OracleClient. It will be nice to have a real standard in the future I suppose.

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: Well, VFP had been 'killed' a while ago. Anyway, if they plan to kill Ole DB I doubt they will produce a new ODBC for VFP... The last ODBC driver for VFP supports VFP6.0 only, so it doesn't support many new features that came into VFP after that.<br /> <br />
item.content:encoded: Well, VFP had been ‘killed’ a while ago. Anyway, if they plan to kill Ole DB I doubt they will produce a new ODBC for VFP… The last ODBC driver for VFP supports VFP6.0 only, so it doesn’t support many new features that came into VFP after that.

item.title: By: Craig
item.dc:creator: Craig
item.content:encoded:
Good riddance.
Maybe this will finally help convince my company to stop developing for OLE DB and move on to ODBC. While Denali looks good, I am already excited for post-Denali.

However, since Microsoft says that they will continue to support it for another 7 years, I am sure that my company will wait exactly 7 years to change…
